item.title: Ross Mounce
item.description: How on earth is Elsevier‚Äôs ‚ÄòJournal of Cleaner Production‚Äô a ‚Äúhighly-ranked‚Äù journal title. https://retractionwatch.com/2024/02/05/no-data-no-problem-undisclosed-tinkering-in-excel-behind-economics-paper/ If you‚Äôve ever read typical papers in this journal üò¨ you‚Äôll know what I mean. One really has to wonder about journal rankings. Levels of fraud & sloppiness seem to abound in ‚Äúhighly-ranked‚Äù ones. We need to start looking beyond ‚Äúhighly-ranked‚Äù journals. And actually read papers, data & code

item.title: claudiakincaid
item.description: Oh my god: https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2024/feb/11/english-test-scandal-students-renew-fight-to-clear-names-after-10-years

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
@thetransmitter
I‚Äôd like to give a shout out to Adrienne Fairhall (U Washington) and Pam Reinagel (UCSD).A few decades ago when I was in graduate school, I noticed that computationally inclined neuroscience labs were a bit like superhero troupes - always many guys and one girl. I (along with many others) watched carefully how Adrienne and Pam (a handful of years ahead) navigated that space, cheering them on from afar as they landed faculty positions, started families, and made their way through promotions. They were the existence proof for me and many others that even if we are the only girl in the room, we can do this too.

item.title: Alicia Izquierdo
item.description: Shout out to my engineer mom who encouraged me as a little girl and is still in my corner when the going gets tough ü¶æ#womenInSTEM #WomenInScience

item.title: Clare
item.description: Last one for #SuperbOwl Sunday. Owls (and other Arctic Predators, avian and mammal) use rises and hummocks to scan for prey, using the same spots year after year. Their waste and remains of prey fertilize the spot and the plants grow taller there than the surrounding tundra. Here a juvenile Snowy peers at me from such a spot. #Nunavut #Arctic #WildlifePhotography #Birding

item.title: Dave Tang
item.description: There's this course called the Missing Semester (https://missing.csail.mit.edu/) that teaches you the practical stuff like using the CLI, shell scripting, Git, Vim, etc. It was created for CS students who apparently don't learn these things in class. But as a biochemistry/microbiology major turned bioinformatician, I need the CS course instead!

item.title: Carsen Stringer (she/her)
item.description: @NicoleCRust @thetransmitter I remember seeing Adrienne speak at the first cosyne I went to and it was an awesome and inspiring talk, it got me really excited about spontaneous activity.I also remember early in grad school reading Kanaka Rajan's paper about eigenspectra of random neural networks, and being really inspired by it. I was working on spiking neural networks at the time, and there were very few women working in that area. (https://journals.aps.org/prl/abstract/10.1103/PhysRevLett.97.188104)

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: Did the dinosaur-killing asteroid 66 million years ago drive the evolution of living birds? Or were they steadily evolving for tens of millions of years already? The DNA and the fossils seem to be telling different stories. Here's my story on the stories [gift link] https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/12/science/bird-evolution-asteroid-dinosaurs.html?unlocked_article_code=1.U00.2Fwl.iaTtz21qtUAO&smid=url-share

item.description: Hundreds of Christians begin 240-hour climate change protest outside ParliamentActivists will swap in and out every few hours to ensure a round-the-clock presencehttps://www.shropshirestar.com/news/uk-news/2024/02/14/hundreds-of-christians-begin-240-hour-climate-change-protest-outside-parliament/#religion #Shropshire #UK #MassExtinction #pollution #ecology #environment #climate #ClimateStrike

item.title: The Transmitter
item.description: Are you interested in writing an essay for The Transmitter? To pitch an idea, write a paragraph or two describing the scope of the piece and your ‚Äútake.‚Äù Note why it‚Äôs timely, and describe specific evidence you‚Äôll use to support your argument. Learn more: https://www.thetransmitter.org/editorial-policies/#writing-scientists?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=org-social&utm_campaign=2024214-writing-scientists
